programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: Euro 96 England v Netherlands - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces action from the memorable Group A match, which came from Wembley Stadium. Bob Wilson presented the coverage, with analysis from John Barnes and Jack Charlton, and commentary by Brian Moore and Kevin Keegan.

programme.title: Night Vision
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from across Scotland.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates flavour-packed recipes.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny faces three target challenges, but will he succeed and avoid a gunge-filled forfeit?.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: An accident at an asteroid-based mining facility sends the rock hurtling toward the Sun, with crewman Ned Tedford still on-site. Alan and Kayo deploy Thunderbird Three for the rescue mission, but when a rogue solar flare knocks out their sensors, they are forced to find a way to alter the asteroid's trajectory so that it loops around the sun instead of plummeting to its ultra-hot surface. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rasmus Hardiker and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy challenges MK to deliver an order in an allotted time to the Monkey King, so MK goes through obstacles that challenge his focus in order to accomplish his goal..

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Demon Bull King's family has found a mysterious power source that will allow them to reclaim their former glory, but it's locked behind an ancient gate. The key to it, which can open any door, was given to MK as thanks for saving the city over and over - after messing around with the key, Red Son finds them. A game of cat and mouse ensues as DBK's family tries to get the key and MK and Mei attempt to keep it away..

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is fed up with being chosen all the time - every time a student is summoned to the blackboard or asked to perform a chore, he's the one picked out! When Mr Brick plans to choose someone to be John-Cedrick's partner for the I Love My School civic project, Mo decides to use the Spectral Spectre to avoid that fate. He wants to become invisible, but when his best friend Lenny gets chosen instead, Mo will have to get his friend out of this terrible situation..

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Ever since they found out that Hollywood film star Timothy Bloom is JC's cousin, JC's 'courtiers' follow him around the school. Sam and Stella are shocked at his abuse of power, but Mo doesn't really care... that is, until he is forbidden from entering the school bathroom as it is now exclusively used as JC's headquarters. This is the last straw - determined to eliminate JC's 'royal court', Mo asks the Sceptre for the power to turn whoever he wants into his own courtier..

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at the house by Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts and former Welsh rugby union star Scott Quinnell, with recipes for tagine, jalfrezi chicken and steak. Plus, chefs Sabrina Gidda and Daniel Galmiche serve up some mouth-watering dishes of their own.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes featuring herbs, cooking a breakfast dish of huevos rancheros with pico de gallo, and a fish sandwich with a tamarind mayo. Thuy Pham marries herbs with Vietnamese speciality banh xeo pancakes, while actress and keen cook Lisa Snowdon makes pan-fried mackerel with warm herb and rice salad.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 1.50 Morebattle Hurdle from Kelso, supported by races at 1.15, 2.25, 3.00 and 3.35. Plus, races at 1.30 and 3.15 from Doncaster, and 2.10 and 2.45 from Newbury. With analysis from Luke Harvey and Andrew Thornton, reports by Oli Bell and Natalie Green, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most nail-biting end games from the Tipping Point archives.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Len Goodman, Nicki Chapman, Will Kirk and Joe Pasquale pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts another charity edition of the game show, with Lady Leshurr, Gabby Logan and Adam Thomas trying to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the good cause of their choice.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Rapper Big Zuu is the Star Guest Announcer and there's the world premiere of whodunit Murder at Bigwig Manor starring a whole host of ITV faces, including Joel Dommett, Davina McCall, Keith Lemon and Judi Love. Plus, heaps of surprises for the audience and everyone at home.

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Olly Murs hosts as four more teams of superfans are transformed into their music idols before stepping onto the stage to sing one of their biggest hits. Panellists Adam Lambert, Shania Twain, Beverley Knight and Jason Manford decide their favourite of the night before the voting audience pick just one person to go through to the series final.

The pair finish in the capital Budapest, where Barney has arranged to meet a world-famous escapologist.

programme.title: The Widow
programme.desc: The search for Will takes Georgia across the border to the neighbouring country of Rwanda. On her arrival, she prepares to finally learn the answers about what really happened to her husband, but she is not ready for what she finds there. Drama by Harry and Jack Williams about a woman who travels to Kinshasa in the Democratic Republic of Congo to uncover the truth about the death of her husband three years previously. Starring Kate Beckinsale, Alex Kingston, Charles Dance and Ariel Helgason.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

On top of this, there's a mouse loose and Mum takes refuge in the shed, leaving Dad in charge of making dinner. Jim pops round to see if he can help, and is invited for his first-ever Friday night dinner with the Goodmans. Comedy, with Mark Heap.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Renee Maloney, the co-founder of art class studios Painting with a Twist, goes undercover in her own organisation to make sure that her growth projections for the company are possible. She works in disguise with her own staff including an art instructor, a trainee manager and a franchise owner.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Dudan, founder and CEO of environmental services company AdvantaClean, dons a disguise to work incognito among his own staff - including a project manager, a mould-removal technician and a cleaning technician - to ensure his franchise owners are following his template for success.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm meets a chess-playing layabout who could be an older version of himself, Lois cannot understand why she is putting on weight and Francis objects to Piama posing nude in an art class - but eagerly volunteers himself when he finds out how much the job pays. Guest starring Jason Alexander (Seinfeld).

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lois goes into labour, coinciding with a less inspiring surprise in the form of a visit from Grandma Ida (Cloris Leachman). Family comedy, with Frankie Muniz and Jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Part two of two. Hal hurries home to be with Lois during her labour, but in his panic he crashes the car. Comedy, starring Bryan Cranston, Jane Kaczmarek, Frankie Muniz and Cloris Leachman.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Hal and Lois try to organise suitable day care for the new arrival and find their best option is at a nearby church. Meanwhile, Francis takes advantage of recent reports of UFOs in the area. Christopher Kennedy Masterson, Bryan Cranston and Jane Kaczmarek star.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: The Wilkersons travel to Las Vegas, where Hal is bitten by the gambling bug and bets his life insurance policy, and Lois sees her favourite singer at a show. Guest starring David Cassidy.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Dewey makes up an incredible story to entertain the baby, and Hal goes out to buy nappies while Lois is asleep - only to find himself accused of being a shoplifter.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Stevie ends up in shock when he learns the truth about Kitty and Abe's divorce, while Dewey tries to get more attention from the family by eating baby food. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Erik Per Sullivan.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm goes off to a boozy Thanksgiving party, where he meets a good-looking girl who seems intent on flirting with him. Reese is left to prepare the dinner with Hal and Dewey roped in as his assistants, while Francis and Piama arrive at the house almost ready to divorce.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm uses Reese as the subject of his school experiment, and Francis struggles to keep his poise when he falls victim to a nasty reviewer. Dewey starts performing as a street entertainer to earn extra cash. Family comedy, starring Frankie Muniz, Justin Berfield and Christopher Masterson.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm discovers the awful secret Lois has been hiding, while Hal's father-and-child classes become more interesting once he starts betting on babies. Dewey runs away to be with Francis after growing tired of the rest of the family. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a meltdown when she feels the pressure of what it would mean for women everywhere if she were to win a Nobel Prize. Raj and Howard attempt to relive the good old days when Howard buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years earller.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is worried that people won't take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Penny encourages Leonard to stand up for himself when he aims to become the principal investigator on a plasma physics study.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Barry Kripke finds proof that Dr Pemberton plagiarised his thesis in college, Sheldon and Amy aren't sure whether they should turn their rival in or not. Howard is surprised but happy to learn that Bernadette wasn't the only waitress at The Cheesecake Factory who had a crush on him back in the day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is pleasantly surprised when his mother Beverly arrives and is genuinely kind to him - until he finds out the real reason for her visit. Denise and Stuart overstay their welcome at Howard and Bernadette's. Christine Baranski guest stars.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy stay up all night as they await a telephone call that could bring big news from the Nobel Committee - is everything in their lives about to change?.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the US sitcom, there's an end and a beginning as the gang travel together into an uncharted future. Howard and Bernadette go away on a trip without their children for the first time, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, Sheldon and Amy stick together, and Raj makes a new friend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonard's apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon helps Leonard drop off a parcel for Penny, but when he sees how messy her flat is, he tries to do a good deed - which is not well received. Johnny Gale, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Alice Levine, Asim Chaudhry, Liza Tarbuck, Russell Howard and Tim Vine perform wheelbarrow stunts, build with fruit and emerge from wardrobes, as they compete for the ultimate prize - Taskmaster Greg Davies's disembodied head dipped in gold. As always, Alex Horne is on hand to assist with quiet dignity.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck shows her hatred of small toy men, Alice Levine tries to fathom darts, and Asim Chaudhry invents a new rain hat.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: John Cena, Nicole Byer and Camille Kostek host the show in which people from all walks of life compete over extreme obstacle courses to become the champion and win a cash prize.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: John Cena, Nicole Byer and Camille Kostek host the show in which people from all walks of life compete over extreme obstacle courses to become the champion and win a cash prize.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: VOTW
programme.desc: What a tune! Check out our video of the week.

programme.title: Pop Power! Billion Steams Club
programme.desc: Join Abbie McCarthy as she brings you music from all those chart-topping artists to gain membership to the Billion Steams Club. Hold tight for the pop power.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: Louis becomes obsessed with the great outdoors after seeing new movie Legends of the Fall, and for his 40th birthday, decides that the family needs to go camping.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: Elaine tries to give Jessica tips on building a better relationship with Grandma Huang. Louis challenges Emery to a 'good luck' wrestling match to start Chinese New Year.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: The Demon Who Came in from the Cold
programme.desc: When Phoebe kills a demon who turns out to be Cole's brother, he goes undercover in the hope of infiltrating an internet organisation run by an evil group called the Brotherhood of the Thorn - demons hand-picked by the Source.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Piper learns she has the power to alter the speed of molecules, resulting in uncontrollable explosions. Meanwhile, the evil Brotherhood plots to sabotage Cole's relationship with Phoebe in an attempt to make him revert to his evil alter ego. Supernatural drama, starring Holly Marie Combs.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: A nervous Danny is offered a cameo role on a popular daytime TV show - and when he charms one of the leading actresses, she decides to make him her new love interest. Tucker and Ben come up with an inventive way to get Bonnie out of their flat and back into her own.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie gets depressed about all the losers she has been dating, so Ben and Danny compete to see who can pair her up with the perfect guy. Determined to beat his big brother at something, Ben arranges for Bonnie to date one of his customers, while Danny sets her up with Ben's boss. Meanwhile, Riley and Tucker find themselves involved in their neighbour Sondra's marital problems. Starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: A no-nonsense Nigerian mum who raises her kids in a strict culture of respect swaps lives with an overwhelmed woman whose disconnected husband and spoilt children run the house.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Roper, President and CEO of quick-service Tex-Mex restaurant chain Taco Bueno, disguises himself to work in secret among his own staff to gain more insight before growing the business. He works alongside general managers, a drive-through server and a supervisor at a tortilla-making plant.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Carona, the founder and CEO of property management company Associa, goes undercover in his own organisation to see first-hand how his employees - including a maintenance supervisor and technician, a concierge and a home inspector - are responding to recent changes at the firm.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah & Mason's, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentine's Day - the busiest night of the year.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Tucker's latest failed relationship prompts him to focus on the one that got away - his college girlfriend Olivia. In an effort to cheer their friend up, Ben and Danny track Olivia down in the hope of reuniting the lovebirds, but when Tucker meets Olivia he gets a big surprise. Elsewhere, ambitious Riley gets into trouble when she overuses her corporate credit card to network and pull in new clients.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: An Officer and a Gentle Ben
programme.desc: Fleet Week sees Bonnie meet up with handsome Captain Hudson, with whom she has a yearly fling, but she gets into a panic when he proposes to her. Ben and Riley make an effort to define their relationship but keep getting their wires crossed. Riley's colleague Robyn takes a fancy to Danny and asks Riley to set them up on a date.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Hal and the boys enter the season of goodwill in a competitive spirit when the local church starts to undercut them on Christmas tree prices. Meanwhile, Otto's bickering relatives arrive, giving Francis a taste of home. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Bryan Cranston.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: The Wilkersons come home early from holiday to discover the neighbours are in the middle of a street party celebrating their absence - prompting them to go on a charm offensive to win over the locals. Starring Frankie Muniz, Bryan Cranston and Jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny hosts a Halloween costume party, which proves a worthy test for the boys' social skills. During the event, Leonard has a run-in with Penny's ex-boyfriend. Kaley Cuoco, Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg star.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by Miles Jupp and Greg Davies. Holly Walsh presides alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The comedians are challenged to taste-test some mystery baby food, Russell Howard presents a nightmarish fairy tale and Liza Tarbuck introduces a plastic lizard to a cordless drill.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Johnny Vegas, Vernon Kay, Lorraine Pascale and Henning Wehn to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by Miles Jupp and Greg Davies. Holly Walsh presides alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: Thrill-seeking contestants compete on the world's largest obstacle course, which includes Donut Run, Crazy Beams, Pole Vault, the Toothbrush Sweeper and Launch Pads among its extreme challenges.

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a top 50 countdown of 'kick-ass animals' on the internet. The amusing clips feature a woman swimming with a great white shark, a mad Brazilian goat, a clothes-stealing orang-utan and lots of playful cats.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day, Jessica and Louis compete to give Evan the best advice on how to celebrate with his new girlfriend. Meanwhile, Eddie is passed a love note.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: Evan starts acting up at school and is forced to miss his next fencing match, putting his perfect record in jeopardy, so Jessica immediately blames it on Eddie's influence.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Piper fights to rescue Phoebe, who has been turned into a banshee intent on seeking human prey, and Prue, whose soul is trapped in the body of a Siberian husky. However, saving Cole from the dark side may prove her greatest challenge. Supernatural drama, starring Holly Marie Combs, Alyssa Milano and Shannen Doherty.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: After being exposed as witches on national TV, the sisters decide their only option is to form a pact with the Source to reverse time and undo the damage - but in the process one of them has to make the ultimate sacrifice. Supernatural drama, starring Shannen Doherty and Holly Marie Combs.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Tucker's latest failed relationship prompts him to focus on the one that got away - his college girlfriend Olivia. In an effort to cheer their friend up, Ben and Danny track Olivia down in the hope of reuniting the lovebirds, but when Tucker meets Olivia he gets a big surprise. Elsewhere, ambitious Riley gets into trouble when she overuses her corporate credit card to network and pull in new clients.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: An Officer and a Gentle Ben
programme.desc: Fleet Week sees Bonnie meet up with handsome Captain Hudson, with whom she has a yearly fling, but she gets into a panic when he proposes to her. Ben and Riley make an effort to define their relationship but keep getting their wires crossed. Riley's colleague Robyn takes a fancy to Danny and asks Riley to set them up on a date.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: A by-the-book school teacher swaps lives with a conspiracy-obsessed home-schooling mum who teaches her kids the world is flat.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Carona, the founder and CEO of property management company Associa, goes undercover in his own organisation to see first-hand how his employees - including a maintenance supervisor and technician, a concierge and a home inspector - are responding to recent changes at the firm.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Recording artist Darius Rucker goes undercover to find America's next great musical act. Darius first gained fame as lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist of rock band Hootie & the Blowfish, selling over 16 million records and winning two Grammys. He then went on to have a successful solo career as a county music artist. Now Darius wants to find talented but undiscovered new music acts and help launch their careers, so dons a disguise to work at an open mic night, as a roadie and a busker in his efforts to locate fresh songwriting and performing talent.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah & Mason's, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. Members of staff complain their pay cheques bounce, and the kitchen cooler is so unhygienic that Gordon makes the decision to close the restaurant on Valentine's Day - the busiest night of the year.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben panics when he realises he has forgotten his mother's birthday yet again, so he enlists an unwilling Danny, Tucker and Riley to organise a celebration in a hurry. However, when Danny learns something unexpected about his own birthday, Bonnie's party gains new significance. Emma hurts herself on Riley and Tucker's watch and they tie themselves in knots trying to hide her injury. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: You Give Real Estate a Bad Name
programme.desc: Bonnie is elated when she has a chance of being appointed as the real-estate agent responsible for a celebrity penthouse sale. However, she later discovers she's competing with her former boyfriend Brad for the job. Danny is happily dating his new girlfriend Robyn, but is disturbed to realise that she seems to have more in common with Ben.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm is made editor of the school's literary magazine, but finds himself forced to censor a story. Hal tries to ingratiate himself with the woman in the office responsible for cutbacks, while Francis teaches Otto to dance. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Bryan Cranston.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Hal splashes out on a new hot tub. Malcolm gets involved in a dispute with Polly's former boyfriend, and Otto confronts one of Francis's old enemies. Family comedy, guest starring Julie Hagerty (Airplane!) and Kenneth Mars (The Producers).

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to take Howard's place in the boys' video-game night while he is otherwise engaged with one of her friends. Simon Helberg, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Vic Reeves and Sara Pascoe joining team captains Sean Lock and Lee Mack. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the numbers and letters.

programme.desc: This time, Russell Howard gets some new tattoos, Tim Vine strips to his waist, and Alice Levine clumsily copies the work of Leonardo da Vinci using squirty cream.

programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Melanie C, Tess Daly, Joe Wilkinson and Andrew Maxwell to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show.

programme.sub-title: These Boots Are Made for Walkin'
programme.desc: Emery starts skipping his volleyball practice, prompting Louis and Evan to investigate. Louis then discovers Emery taking up line dancing in a bar.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Part one of two. While Piper and Phoebe mourn the death of Prue, the Source uncovers the identity of a woman who can restore the Power of Three and renew the sisters' strength as witches.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Part two of two. While Piper and Phoebe continue to grieve over the loss of Prue, the Source plots to stop Paige restoring the sisters' strength as witches by luring her over to the dark side.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben panics when he realises he has forgotten his mother's birthday yet again, so he enlists an unwilling Danny, Tucker and Riley to organise a celebration in a hurry. However, when Danny learns something unexpected about his own birthday, Bonnie's party gains new significance. Emma hurts herself on Riley and Tucker's watch and they tie themselves in knots trying to hide her injury. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: You Give Real Estate a Bad Name
programme.desc: Bonnie is elated when she has a chance of being appointed as the real-estate agent responsible for a celebrity penthouse sale. However, she later discovers she's competing with her former boyfriend Brad for the job. Danny is happily dating his new girlfriend Robyn, but is disturbed to realise that she seems to have more in common with Ben.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: The subservient wife of a biker who believes men should be waited on hand-and-foot swaps lives with a progressive social media influencer, whose husband takes care of the kids.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Recording artist Darius Rucker goes undercover to find America's next great musical act. Darius first gained fame as lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist of rock band Hootie & the Blowfish, selling over 16 million records and winning two Grammys. He then went on to have a successful solo career as a county music artist. Now Darius wants to find talented but undiscovered new music acts and help launch their careers, so dons a disguise to work at an open mic night, as a roadie and a busker in his efforts to locate fresh songwriting and performing talent.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Chef and restaurateur Marcus Samuelsson goes undercover to find and mentor America's next great chef. An Ethiopian refugee adopted by a Swedish family, Marcus developed a deep love for cooking at an early age and has since become a renowned force in international cuisine, with over 30 restaurants worldwide. Marcus disguises himself to work incognito in a teaching kitchen, a food truck business, a culinary institute and a soup kitchen, as he searches for undiscovered chefs to mentor.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley realises she has to tell Danny she has feelings for him before his relationship with Robyn gets more serious. Tucker is unhappy with his love life, so Ben and Bonnie invent a secret admirer to give him some much needed confidence. However, the plot goes awry when they use a random photo of a model and Tucker encounters her by chance in the street.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.sub-title: Home Is Where the Wheeler Is
programme.desc: Riley cannot face the mess she has made out of her relationships with Ben and Danny, so she runs home to her mother's house in New Jersey to hide from her problems. When her next door neighbour Evelyn dies, Bonnie plots for the chance to sell her apartment.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Grandma Ida (Cloris Leachman) announces she is getting married to a rich Chinese man she met on a cruise - but the family is not convinced her intentions toward her fiance are honourable. Meanwhile, Malcolm tries to hide his tongue piercing from his parents.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Berwick-upon-Tweed to the Isle of Man, beginning in the Northumberland village of Bardon Mill. He follows in the footsteps of Victorian archaeologists at Hadrian's Wall, discovers how the introduction of ticket machines transformed 19th-century train travel and learns about the impact of railways on the west Cumbrian town of Wigton.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Cumbria, where he visits the Sellafield site that reprocesses fuel from nuclear reactors, drinks a Victorian brew made from the waters of Cockermouth and explores a Japanese-inspired garden created in the 19th century.

programme.title: Scouting for Toys
programme.desc: Featuring Graham Hamilton, who has collected every Matchbox model car released between 1961 to 1982: amassing more than 2,000 vehicles, many of them incredibly rare..

programme.title: Scouting for Toys
programme.desc: The auctioneers try to value a remarkable set of toy theatres - some more than 150 years old with expert advice from Pollock's Toy Museum.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The incredible efforts to ensure that the hastily constructed temporary fix around the damaged reactor at Chernobyl becomes a permanent solution, known as the New Safe Confinement.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How a team of intrepid engineers keep the London Array, one of the largest offshore wind farms on the planet, maintained and producing electricity whatever the weather.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek rubs shoulders with pop music royalty when he picks up a Morgan sports car, while a Second World War ambulance arrives at Thornton le Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: This week at the Mathewsons', there's a 1982 Audi Quattro and a Sunbeam Alpine. Plus, Derek takes delivery of a beautiful green Renault van, previously used as a bread van in Paris.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Scotland in the mother of all rainstorms to pick up a Jaguar E-type and a rare MGC convertible. Plus, Dave extracts a rare Austin Gipsey from a lock up.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There's a surprise for Derek in Hull - an MGSA sports car that once had a tree growing through it. Plus, in North Wales, Alan Holmes is selling his son's Ford Escort RS 1600i.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek picks up a rare Ford Zodiac Farnham Estate, while Dave heads for an isolated tent in the Midlands to collect a Triumph Toledo.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a ghost town in Colorado, the remnants of an industrial enterprise in Puerto Rico and a remote village on Cyprus.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a jungle refuge concealing a story of royal deceit, nuclear bunkers infiltrated by outsiders, and a haunted hospital marked by scandal.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a beachside resort with ties to the Russian mafia, a windswept base hiding lifesaving technology, and a site in Iowa plagued by its past.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to sample the delights of the Atlantic coasts of Spain and France, beginning in Bordeaux, where he uncovers a historic British connection to the region's wines. Across the border in San Sebastian, Michael learns how diplomacy brought Britain and Spain closer together and rides on a hair-raising scenic railway. Heading to Bilbao, he explores the industrial ties between France and Spain and learns to cook a traditional Basque dish.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Gruber finishes the paintings and the spy camera sent from London has fallen into a vineyard where the peasants are refusing to work for fear of being shot.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General von Klinkerhoffen visits the vineyard where Rene and the Resistance are working, and jeopardises their scheme to return the British airmen home.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: First episode of the Second World War comedy set in German-occupied France about the misadventures of womanising cafe owner Rene Artois, whose cafe is commandeered by the Resistance to shelter two airmen. Starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Two iconic classics find their way to the Mathewsons' auction room. Dave heads to north Manchester to pick up an Austin A30 and a Morris 8E that's had an alternative paint job.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A multi-billion-pound 32km super sewer under the streets of London, an early sewer system at the Palace of Knossos and a pivotal piece of tunnel boring equipment from the past.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A vast new island in the seas off Dubai, which has been created to house the world's biggest observation wheel - twice the size of the London Eye.

programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies entered Germany and ran into the imposing Siegfried Line defences. American troops fought to a gruelling, bloody standstill in the Huertgen Forest, at a terrible cost.

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway explore Clapham South deep level shelter, where thousands of Londoners slept during the Second World War.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins his journey in Kirkby-in-Furness, Cumbria, where he learns about the village's famous blue slates. He then heads to Barrow to examine the secret world of nuclear submarines and finishes his trip in Lancaster, where he discovers why executions at the castle drew so many spectators in Victorian times.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ends his journey across northern England by setting sail from Heysham, Lancashire, to visit the Isle of Man, where he learns about the horse-drawn trams of Douglas, reveals the 19th-century secrets of the Laxey Waterwheel and explores the Victorian history of the Snaefell mountain railway.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next stage of his journey in which he travels from the naval hub of Portsmouth to Grimsby docks. programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking in Surrey to Clapham Junction in south London. Along the way he gets close to some precious Victorian botany at Kew Gardens, tries his hand at croquet and discovers a very surprising 19th-century place of worship.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Whistler on the Canadian Pacific seaboard, a remote mountain town whose creation was made possible with record-breaking engineering equipment, helping establish one of the best ski resorts in the world.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Nato's Airborne Warning and Control System, known as Awac, a cutting-edge aircraft with a huge radar dome mounted on its roof that enables pilots to spot hostile intrusion as they protect state borders of the countries in the Nato alliance. One of the most complex surveillance aircrafts in the world, it is able to seek out, locate, and defend against threats - no matter how fast moving or well hidden.

programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls-Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: The search reaches the New Forest, and after an encounter with some ponies, Tim Medhurst buys a horse, while Christina Trevanion turns farrier. Other items include a George III commode and some Scottish treasure.

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Cornwall to help Sean and Janine, the owners of Northshore, Bude's only hostel. Having returned from travelling the world, the pair bought the property to keep their travelling dream alive. Running the hostel is the best job Sean's ever had - but a shocking downturn in occupancy and their unorthodox living scenario have left Janine wanting out. Desperate to sort the business, the couple call on Alex's advice in a last-ditch attempt to resolve matters. The expert arrives with a few surprises up her sleeve, but quickly learns saving this business isn't going to be easy.

programme.title: Body Parts
programme.desc: Renowned anaplastologist Allison Vest creates life-changing prosthetics. She helps a man who lost his nose and a cancer survivor seeking new nipples..

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin go in search of evidence of paranormal activity at Oman House, a Los Angeles mansion with links to the Charles Manson murders and a Native American burial ground.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes and other previously unseen bits.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig invites Aisling Bea, Corey Taylor and Ross Noble and Alan Davies to answer questions on subjects associated with nosey and noisy in an extended edition of the comedy panel game. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Jon and Lucy agree to hamster-sit for the neighbours, Jon tries out new stand-up material, and Lucy uses a corporate gig as a chance to stage a protest against the fossil fuel industry.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glenn Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson keep their eyes on the prize as Richard Osman reveals who is the week's winner.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Guest host Stephen Mangan is joined by Ross Noble and Ria Lina on an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Montreal, Canada where replicas of a DeLorean and the Ghostbusters' Ecto-1 are among the vehicles taking part in the downhill race.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As auctioneer Sean Kelly and the team arrive in Gwent, Heavy D confuses the other bidders and himself. Meanwhile, Nat takes a gamble, but John is far from happy.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Leeds.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Certified 'indoorsman' Phil Wang convinces best friend Pierre Novellie - also not much better at outdoor stuff - to join him in Lesotho, Africa's Kingdom in the Sky.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister comes down with a mutated strain of pneumonia that makes his feverish hallucinations come to life. Some of them turn out to be very tricky customers indeed, and wage a war over control of the patient's mind. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Craig Ferguson.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and the Cat are horrified when Rimmer duplicates himself, but their shock turns to hilarity when the identically petty pair move in together, only to find they are not very well matched. Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by TV presenters Dale Winton and Richard Bacon, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes comic actress Miranda Hart and sports presenter Clare Balding. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by comedian Rhod Gilbert and actress Sally Phillips, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes TV presenters Des O'Connor and Tess Daly. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A missing toy keyring leads to a rift between Lee and Lucy and their best friends and former neighbours Toby and Anna. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe).

credits.actor: a guest appearance from former EastEndersAnnette Badland (Aunt Babe)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes and other previously unseen bits.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on the latest events in news and politics, with the help of Tom Allen, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Thanyia Moore. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the panel show, and invites Jason Manford, Sara Pascoe, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies to answer questions on the subject of 'noble rot'. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer tries desperately to earn a commission and qualify for transfer from Red Dwarf to an advanced holoship containing the cream of the Space Corps, and a woman he has developed feelings for. Starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A mechanical life form named the Inquisitor's quest to eliminate worthless beings brings him aboard Red Dwarf, where he has plenty of candidates to choose from. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer is taken prisoner on a planet where the inhabitants and landscape are created by his own mind and is subjected to a series of gruesome tortures devised by his imagination, leaving the rest of the crew to come up with a way to rescue him. Starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Jon Richardson guests hosts an extended episode of the satirical current affairs quiz, with Joan Bakewell and Phil Wang joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Actress Lea Thompson guests on the classic improv show with Wayne Brady, Jonathan Mangum, Colin Mochrie, Ryan Stiles and hosted by Aisha Tyler.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler welcomes Katie Cassidy to the classic improv show, with regulars Wayne Brady, Brad Sherwood, Colin Mochrie and Ryan Stiles..

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in an engineering contest against pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar. This time, they take on the iconic Land Rover Discovery in an off-road hill climb. To defeat such a thoroughbred, the teams need to demonstrate their innovation and imagination.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John and Dave get rid of unwanted skips and trailers, which are home to some unusual objects. Elsewhere, emergency repairs are required to get two police bikes back out on the road.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police hunt for a man suspected of stealing rural machinery, rush to a derelict factory to seize firearms, and investigate a car accident..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police execute a search warrant on a counterfeiting market stall and intervene to get an excessively low-riding car off the road for good..

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The drama, scheming and backstabbing continue once again as the tribe comes together and decides to exclude a particularly vocal member from participating in camp and strategic talk..

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits Mumbai in search of the bombil, the fish used in Bombay duck, and also enjoys Parsee hospitality and learns about their contribution to Indian cuisine. He then travels south to Pondicherry, where locals prepare Indian dishes with a French twist, before heading north along the coast to Mamallapuram to sample one of the best fish curries he has ever had. Rick also demonstrates how to make popular Parsee chicken dish sali murgh and personal favourite aloo mattar.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Bankstown detectives take down a drug syndicate which is dealing methylamphetamine, and officers respond to an incident where a driver has hit cars..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Members from the sexual crime squad serve a warrant on a man accused of procuring a woman and her 13-year-old daughter for sex..

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Pressure mounts for the force to replace an ageing 4x4 vehicle, and a vehicle maintenance worker opens the workshop for the last time in his 42-year career.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness head to Thailand on a road-trip in old pick-ups. Back in Britain, Chris tests out the astonishing Rimac Nevera, an electric two-seater that might just be the fastest car on the planet..

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event in Peru, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The five comics go undercover as they try to impress Greg Davies with their attempts at high-level espionage.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: It's time for the grand final, which features peas, teas and absent keys, as Ed Gamble, Jo Brand, Katy Wix and Rose Matafeo vie to go home with Greg Davies's massive golden face.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites boxer Nicola Adams, comedian Frankie Boyle and comedy actress Diane Morgan to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include magicians, losing one's keys and life itself.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the 12th series of the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Jo Brand, Olivia Colman, Stacey Dooley, Aston Merrygold, Diane Morgan, Bob Mortimer, Richard Osman, Lucy Porter, Jon Richardson, Henning Wehn and Shaun Williamson to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, as comedians Phill Jupitus and Bridget Christie and Only Connect presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of public and private.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Guest host Alexander Armstrong, journalist and broadcaster Mishal Husain and comedian Geoff Norcott join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they compete in an extended edition of the satirical quiz, delving into the headlines of the past seven days.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets challenges for Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan, Frank Skinner and Josh Widdicombe. They attempt to build a tower for an egg to see who can get it the highest and make a video 'blooper'.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at the events of June 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth, Victoria Coren Mitchell and Jimmy Carr join series regular Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme of 'not nearly' in an extended edition of the comedy panel show. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Lucy jets off to LA to launch her Hollywood career - leaving Jon on his own with a plan to prank his best mate Matt Forde - and a potentially career-defining audition with a genuine TV legend.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Sneakerhead
programme.desc: The first episode of a contemporary workplace sitcom set in Peterborough. Loveable pushover Russell becomes the manager of Sports Depot.

programme.title: Ladhood
programme.desc: Having started a fight with a stranger, for the crime of having a conversation with his girlfriend, Liam thinks back to his adolescence and where this toxic behaviour stems from. Comedy written by and starring Liam Williams, which straddles two timelines to explore the roots of modern-day masculinity by delving into the memories of his own misspent adolescence.

programme.desc: John, Dave and Ros get an excuse to show off their knowledge of the second-hand police car market when end of service service vehicles are put up for auction.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police stop a speeding motorcyclist, are called to a car accident, and identify a man using stolen credit cards in Western Australia..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Victoria police arrive at the house of a suspected drug dealer, and an officer called Tiffany pursues a biker called Tiffany in Western Australia..

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The end is in sight on the Island of Paradise when Mike makes a risky decision and breaks the Amigos' embargo by openly talking tactics with Jacques and Durao in front of everyone..

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Operation Scado is a visible and extensive two-week police operation targeting illicit drugs, but there are other officers simultaneously working undercover..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Police in Australia investigate an armed robbery at a jewellery store, a car accident, and a vehicle detected by the Fairfield Highway Patrol..

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work of a team of mechanics who build bespoke cars for the Merseyside Police. Emergency surgery is needed when a brand-new prisoner van gets on the wrong side of a rooftop protestor. Boss Mick spends some time behind bars - all in the name of research, while the mounted unit needs help to get to the Liverpool-Everton derby.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness hit the German autobahn in a trio of shiny new supercars from Ferrari, Pagani and Porsche. At the other end of the speed scale, they try out the latest electric micro-cars with a treasure hunt around Paris.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff samples the brutal, full-contact motorsport of F1 stock cars, while Chris Harris gets to grips with Mercedes' F1 car for the road, the fearsomely complicated AMG One. Paddy McGuinness takes a ride in the luxurious new Range Rover.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill, as it arrives in Paris.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: A two-part special welcoming back the champions from the first five series - Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer return for more consensual indignity at the hands of Greg Davies and Alex Horne.

programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites satirist Charlie Brooker, presenter Scarlett Moffatt and actress Pearl Mackie to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include crocodiles, mosquitoes and having one's hair cut.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Best Bits
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents a special edition looking back over the best moments from the series. programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Hannah Gadsby, Noel Fielding and Joe Lycett join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of pictures, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedians who have appeared on Live at the Apollo over the show's first 16 years take a seat in the stalls of the famous Hammersmith theatre, and share their memories of the series. New interviews with the comics provide a unique insight into how it feels to take to British TV's most famous stand-up stage, alongside classic archive clips from the show.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining amateur cooks' tart-making abilities are put to the test in the third round of the competition. Their first task is to bake a tarte Tatin, with judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry looking for intriguing flavour combinations to tickle their tastebuds. The hopefuls then face another daunting technical challenge as they try to replicate Mary's seemingly straightforward recipe for treacle tart, but the delicate task of adding a lattice top leaves some contestants flummoxed. Finally, they try to create an ornate fruit tart fit for gracing the window display of a leading patisserie - before discovering the identities of the latest Star Baker and the person who will be heading home. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess the remaining contestants' dessert-making skills. The hopefuls start by creating tortes before tackling this week's technical test - the delicate French dish of creme caramel. Though these two rounds provide a stern examination of the amateurs' creative flair and technical ability, they then face possibly the toughest task of the series so far - a six-hour challenge to create a show-stopping layered meringue. Once the sugar has set, who will be this week's Star Baker, and who will be going home? Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to New Orleans and after delving into a roadside seafood market, he cooks in Louis Armstrong Park and meets singer Robin Barnes. programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Having shown they have what it takes to bake a cake or two, the 11 remaining contestants turn their attention to biscuits. First up they create their signature savoury crackers for cheese, and are encouraged to push the flavour. In the technical challenge, they have to prepare Mary Berry's Florentines, with their chewy caramel sauce and brandy-snap texture, before ending with a showstopper like no other - three-dimensional scenes made entirely from biscuits. For one hopeful, there will be the pride of being crowned Star Baker, while another will be sent home - well aware that that's just the way the cookie crumbles. Hosted by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.desc: Tom Kerridge travels across the US discovering the heart and soul of American food. The Michelin-starred chef samples the nation's best dishes and creates new recipes. programme.title: Tom Kerridge's American Feast
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge travels to Oakland in California, where he cooks a spiced pumpkin pie and learns to prepare traditional northern noodles.

programme.title: Donal's Asian Baking Adventure
programme.desc: In Seoul, Donal Skehan visits the Glamorous Penguin Cafe run by Sophia Yoo, who bakes European-style cakes with a Korean twist. Later, he makes Korean dumplings.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants' pie-making skills are put to the test in a trio of demanding tasks. First, the hopefuls try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by making beef Wellington, before creating hand-raised pies during this round's technical challenge - but several of the cooks run into difficulties as they try to work with a pastry dolly for the first time. Finally, the showstopper challenge sees traditional American pies being prepared - before one more baker is eliminated from the competition. From 2012.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The pressure continues to rise as the contestants' pudding-making skills face a stern examination. Their first task involves creating a pair of sponge dishes, before Mary Berry sets the latest technical challenge - recreating her recipe for the meringue-topped dessert queen of puddings. Finally the cooks try to get to grips with the intricacies of baking strudel in the showstopper round - before one of them leaves the competition for good. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins. From 2012.

programme.desc: Ina Garten welcomes award-winning singer and actress Faith Hill with frozen paloma cocktails and guacamole. Later, they bake Coca-Cola cake with Faith's daughter.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares great chicken recipes from the ranch. They include spatchcock chicken sheet pan supper, fabulous peach whisky chicken, and a chicken kale Caesar salad kit.

programme.title: Ainsley Eats The Streets
programme.desc: In Madrid, Ainsley is on a mission to discover how and where the locals eat. Later, he visits the city's first-ever street food festival.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 10 remaining contestants face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by creating 12 perfect rye bread rolls shaped in any way they like and using as much flour as they dare. For the technical challenge they have to prepare Italian ciabatta using Paul's recipe, before ending with show-stopping centrepiece loaves that will have to make an impact on the table as well as on the judges. Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry then decide which of the contenders will be the week's star baker - and which of them is going home. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads towards Louisiana's swamplands, where he ditches his car for a high-speed boat. Then, he travels to the nearby city of Lafayette, where he visits the family run smokehouse, Johnson's Boucaniere, and samples some of their traditional homemade sausage. James also tries ice cream from the legendary Borden's ice cream parlour, before heading back to the swamps to cook one final dish.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's American Feast

programme.desc: Robert is called to J's Restaurant in Waveland, Mississippi. He helps owners Louis and Jeff rescue their business and save their lifelong friendship.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert travels to Mr B's Southern Kitchen in Florida, where he finds a failing restaurant that is tearing siblings Ninkia and Calvin apart.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy embarks on a culinary adventure in Alaska. He checks out a German food truck and a food-and-music restaurant that serves Cuban favourites.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Burlington in Vermont to sample mac and cheese pancakes, and in Ottawa, Canada, he tries an unusual spaghetti pizza dish.

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Gennaro Contaldo head to Naples to seek out the family recipes the locals love to eat, discovering a street snack that is said to predate the modern pizza, before giving a foolproof guide to making the ultimate one at home. On the island of Procida, Jamie is blown away by sensational seafood dishes inspiring him to make a fish poached in 'crazy water'., while there are recipes for a classic margherita and sausage and broccoli pizza, as well as tuna, courgette and crushed almond spaghetti.

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Gennaro Contaldo head off the beaten track to the little-known region of Basilicata in search of old-school Italian recipes, meeting a family of shepherds who still cook as their ancestors did hundreds of years ago. Jamie gives a Sunday roast an Italian spin with his leg of lamb with herby stuffing and roast potatoes with sticky onions, before being put through his paces by an 89-year-old macaroni master and cooking up a simple spicy sausage and sweet pepper pasta.
