programme.desc: The food writer travels to Puglia, where he discovers homemade gelato, homemade burrata cheese, fresh fish at a colourful market, and street food with a big difference.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: From 2011, 12 enthusiastic home-cooks take part in a culinary contest devised by Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. In the first round, the competitors are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours, before being asked to bake a coffee and walnut Battenberg cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The travelling chef ventures into Louisiana's state capital Baton Rouge to experience a unique American phenomenon - tailgating. It's the day of a big football match at Louisiana State University, and the LSU Tigers are playing in front of thousands of fans. Surrounded by people barbecuing, cooking and sharing food from the back of their pick-up trucks, James joins in and cooks up a storm ahead of the game. He also takes time out to visit a Baton Rouge-based oyster restaurant specialising in North American varieties.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, preparing smoked salmon with Yorkshire pudding, beets and asparagus, as well as cooking Greek chicken accompanied by sweet pepper and pea couscous with tzatziki.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a menu of grilled sardines with crispy halloumi, watercress salad and figs, and a chocolate mousse for dessert.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea makes her all-time favourite, cookbook-worthy recipes. She prepares delicious jerk chicken Rasta pasta and chocolate sandwich delights.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea takes on the challenge of making vegan soul food. She makes dishes like lemon-pepper fried 'chicken' tenders and vegan baked mac and cheese.

programme.title: Be My Guest with Ina Garten
programme.desc: Ina Garten welcomes broadcaster Willie Geist to her home. She bakes salted chocolate chunk cookies, and they shake up bourbon sidecars with dried cherries.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares her favourite chocolate treats. She makes white chocolate pudding, Mississippi mud cake, chocolate mousse and chocolate-covered potato chips.

programme.title: Ainsley Eats The Streets
programme.desc: Ainsley arrives in Fes in Morocco ahead of the festival of Eid. He cooks chicken and lemon kebabs over coals in the streets, and makes a classic carrot and chickpea salad.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining six bakers have passed the halfway point of the contest, and now face three European bakes - beginning with yeast-leavened cakes, a tricky cross between cake and bread. Mary Berry then sets them the challenge of rustling up a Swedish princess torte, but they have their work cut out completing all 24 stages of the recipe in little more than two hours. They finish by creating their own version of the dobos torte, a multi-layered cake from Hungary. However, they must go one step further and bake a two-tiered version with an emphasis on caramel. Which of the bakers will come to a sticky end?.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to Boston, where he goes on shopping spree in the public market ahead of cooking with local ingredients. He visits a restaurant where cocktails are often inhaled rather than drunk and finishes by taking a trip to Fenway Park baseball stadium to live out a boyhood dream.

programme.title: Michel Roux's Provence Masterclass
programme.desc: The acclaimed chef demonstrates how to prepare stunning dishes. He serves fish quenelles, chicken cooked in salt crust pastry and red wine poached pears.

programme.title: Ainsley Eats The Streets
programme.desc: Ainsley arrives in Fes in Morocco ahead of the festival of Eid. He cooks chicken and lemon kebabs over coals in the streets, and makes a classic carrot and chickpea salad.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert has 48 hours to rescue Big Tom's Backyard Grill and Bar in Cleveland, Tennessee. This failing restaurant is costing owners Tom and Sabrina their marriage.

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Host and legendary chef Guy Fieri sends four talented chefs running through the aisles in a high-stakes, high skills, grocery store cooking competition.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of saving failing restaurants in two days with a budget of $10,000, this time helping the Ziarinks save their eatery in Keyport, Washington.

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Gennaro Contaldo heads to the island of Sicily, getting a masterclass in local sweets that inspire a chocolate cannoli. In the heart of Catania's fish market, Nonna Rosanna teaches Jamie how to make her sweet and sour tuna dish, and the chef cooks up a tuna, prawn and pistachio spaghetti.

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in Tuscany, where he meets 88-year-old cookbook queen Nonna Miriam, who teaches him her all-time favourite beef stew with homemade pappardelle pasta. Jamie cooks up a ragù that takes the humble spag bol to the next level and heads for the hills, where he recreates a mind-blowing Jewish Italian recipe.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares recipes for four desserts, including a white chocolate pudding, a fast raspberry fool, a quick dessert panini, and caramel apple sauce to make a sundae.

Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond has collected her best one-pan recipes. She makes no-fuss lemon basil shrimp risotto, loaded veggie pasta, chicken fennel bake and crispy grilled cheese.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by Alison Hammond and Aldo Zilli in the first episode of a new cookery series, which focuses on dishes that conjure up memories of holidays. Ainsley prepares spicy Seafood linguine with chilli and cherry tomatoes, Alison makes a Tunisian inspired lamb and cous cous dish, and Aldo gives a masterclass in making crispy chilli and parsley calamari. Finally, Ainsley also whips up a souvlaki and tiramisu.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins set the remaining contestants three tasks involving pastry, beginning by asking them to make signature savoury parcels. For the technical challenge, they must prepare a cake that hails from the Brittany region of France - the kouign amann, which none of the bakers has ever heard of - before creating two different types of eclair in the showstopper round. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood judge the hopefuls' efforts before deciding who is star baker and who is going home.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef explores Salem, Massachusetts, which was made famous by the witch trials of 1692. He visits a unique spice shop, where he picks up some ingredients to cook with, and also meets a seafood artist and makes a stop at Turner's, a family-run seafood business.

programme.title: Chronicles Of Nadiya
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain visits her family village in Bangladesh. Using local produce and techniques she shares her favourite recipes, including baked fish with mango..

programme.title: Forever Summer with Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson focuses on Italian food, preparing pasta with mussels, and black rice with squid rings.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert travels to Mr B's Southern Kitchen in Florida, where he finds a failing restaurant that is tearing siblings Ninkia and Calvin apart.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Life on G Wing looks set to take an unexpected glamorous turn when a footballer's ex-wife arrives at Larkhall. Governor Neil Grayling vows to find out why all his officers' drug tests have come back positive for heroin. Selena heads for Canada in a last-ditch attempt to persuade Milly to clear Kris's name, and virtually all the inmates fall victim to a mysterious illness. First of three special crossover episodes with Footballers' Wives, guest starring Zoe Lucker.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A bewildered Dom throws himself into work as he struggles to process a shocking family secret. However, being around Ange proves difficult, causing Dom to make a drastic decision about his career. Zosia publicly undermines Jac's authority, putting a strain on their already-fraught relationship, and Donna's parenting is called into question.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The medic resolves to track down a mysterious man who callously ignored his request to call for an ambulance - and Finlay's obsession soon leads him into a macabre world. Drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron feels increasingly isolated as the day of Janet and Angus's wedding approaches and Dr Finlay is drawn toward the new National Health Service. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a German mayor visits Great Slaughter to partake in a war memorial ceremony, tragedy strikes; Sister Boniface investigates whether it's a accident or a malicious plan.

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The preliminary rounds of Miss United Britain are well underway, but the beauty queens get a gruesome wakeup call when Miss Northern Ireland is found drowned.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A wealthy Irishwoman descends on the restaurant with her new husband in tow who turns out to be a figure from Margaret's wild past in swinging 1960s London. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Nigel Terry.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe comes to the rescue when a regular customer is hounded by the police, but the sleuthing chef finds himself caught up in a long-running feud between notorious villain Razor Reg Costigan and his arch-rival Striker of the Yard. Offbeat drama, guest starring Nicholas Ball.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a spate of garden thefts, focusing his inquiries on a horticultural landscaper whose business has blossomed since the robberies began. Unfortunately, his initial stake-out proves a disaster and, to top it all, Margaret hires the chief suspect to redesign the plot behind the restaurant. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: In the summer of 1966, the Northumbrian police come under increasing media scrutiny as Sunderland prepares to host a World Cup match involving the USSR, while campaigners protest against the proposed landing of the Polaris nuclear submarine at Jarrow docks. When an academic is found dead after a CND rally, Gently and Bacchus are dispatched to Durham University to investigate his background - and find themselves in the middle of a wave of social and sexual rebellion. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Sarah Lancashire and Warren Clarke.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.sub-title: From the Cradle to the Grave
programme.desc: Chaos ensues when a museum's Egyptian mummy case turns out to contain the body of a very recently deceased woman.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars.

programme.title: Mrs Wilson
programme.desc: After the sudden death of novelist and Secret Intelligence Service worker Alexander Wilson, wife Alison is forced to investigate when mysteries from her late husband's past come knocking. Drama, starring Ruth Wilson, Iain Glen and Keeley Hawes.

Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small.

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Ludovico asks Leonardo to create a sculpture in honour of his father. As he gets distracted from Caterina, Leonardo ends up in a race against time with a costly decision to make.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: Jack's life hangs in the balance as he is rushed to hospital on the Barracuda. Meanwhile, Ken's crafty ways backfire on him when he finds himself a victim of blackmail.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When a man who arranged to meet Lovejoy at the local cricket game dies suddenly, it falls to the antiques dealer to find the fortune that was promised to the widow. The unusual legacy includes a forged snuff box. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Beth treats two youngsters suffering from suspected meningitis, and soon realises they actually have a disease spread by rat urine. Local people lay blame for the infection at the door of a new home for ex-psychiatric patients - prompting Jack to intervene on the residents' behalf. Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton star.

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: A new manager arrives at the recently built Whitbury leisure centre - but things get off to a shaky start when he selects a poolside attendant who cannot swim. First episode of the comedy, starring Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth discovers Emmet has planned a piano concert for the senior citizens at the church hall, and decides to treat the lucky audience to her own brand of sing-song. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and David Griffin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo pulls a piece of antique silver from the canal, and Seymour sets about recovering any other items down there, with the intention of returning them to their rightful owners.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An afternoon driving around in Wesley's car proves to be tough on the feet. Compo is suffering from hard skin and places his faith in a herbal jelly from a gypsy healer. Bill Owen stars.

Amanda Redman and Lynda Bellingham star.

programme.title: Clocking Off
programme.desc: Romance blossoms between secretary Grace and cutter Faz, but the racial prejudices of both their families threaten to tear the relationship apart.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Connie Beauchamp returns and wastes no time in reasserting her authority, taking over the care of a patient in resus and pitching her idea for a trauma theatre to a sceptical Charlie. A number of staff members come in to work hungover following a housewarming party at Alicia's new house.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: With the Sun Hill serial killer still at large, Lennox and Nixon are ready to pounce on any lead no matter how tenuous - so when a foul-tempered member of the public implicates his neighbour, they rush to investigate. programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane teams up with an entrepreneur named Palmer to convert a warehouse into an Art Nouveau antiques centre. However, Lovejoy suspects he is a conman, so muscles in as an adviser on the project. Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan star.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Beth Kerruish has never exactly been a stranger to heartache, and the strain of Isabel's funeral only adds to her woes. To make matters worse, she also finds herself in the unhappy position of having to investigate whether Jack was responsible for a roadside tragedy. Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton star.

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Brittas takes charge of preparations for the official opening of Whitbury Leisure Center, with a royal visitor due to attend. Sadly, the builders dislike him so much they don't bother to tell him that the brand new pool is leaking. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daddy dresses up in a spaceman suit and goes on the rampage in the toy department of a local shop, forcing an embarrassed Hyacinth to intervene. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Walking Through History

programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.desc: A look at one of the most famous Viking coins ever discovered, and a death mask of a girl who drowned in Paris.

programme.title: Storm Stories
programme.desc: In May 1998, the historic town of Sarno in southern Italy was ravaged by rain. Eventually the rain-saturated mountain slopes gave way, with torrents of mud travelling at up to 60 kilometres per hour burying dozens of people. Survivors describe the extreme weather conditions that resulted in the deaths of 161 people.

programme.title: Storm Stories
programme.desc: Chronicling the events of August 16, 2004, when the village of Boscastle in Cornwall was hit by a deluge of torrential rain that overwhelmed the entire community.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Brann Dailor, drummer for the Grammy-winning heavy metal band Mastodon, brings in his 1970 Cadillac Coupe DeVille for some much-needed Counts Kustoms love. Shannon and Ryan bring in a one-of-a-kind motorcycle, owned by a one-of-a-kind woman. Plus, Kevin comes across a 1972 Boat Tail Riviera that he's pretty sure Danny will fall in love with.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After Seth rescinds his invasive search policies for his employees, the women to return to work. The leader soon wrestles with a new problem - profits are down, so he looks at creative ways to get new customers into the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The staff receive complaints from customers that a staff member has been letting customers cut in line in exchange for a tip. They later find out that Anton, who works the pawn desk, is responsible.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth swaps the workstations for two members of his team. However, Les becomes angered at the situation, feeling that the arrangement was good enough in the first place.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Jeff calls in sick, leading to Seth to order everyone to stay away from his desk in any circumstances. He then finds Bobby J in the banned area, polishing a ring for a customer.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Many factors regarding the formation of planet Earth remain far from understood, and while some may write off odd events as random occurrences, they possibly point to a new understanding of not only the planet's past, but also its future. The veteran actor is joined by experts in the field to duscuss such a notion.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Serpent gods are found in many religious texts, but could these stories be describing reptile-like extraterrestrials, and are they still here today?.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: An assessment of whether past plagues have been brought to Earth by aliens and whether the planet is prepared for an extraterrestrial invasion of disease.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Father-and-son duo Paul and Bogart go head to head in Claireville, Toronto, with each hoping to claim the bigger profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Torrance, where Dave sees his profits grow - amongst other things. Mary finds clothes that don't fit her, which turns out to be a good thing. Plus, Kenny takes a chance at being an early bird, but winds up looking more like a dodo.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: What Came First: The Chicken or the Auction?
programme.desc: Overwhelmed by the sheer number of units up for auction in Rialto, Mary and Ivy wager that each can better predict final locker prices than the other. Dave's locker closely resembles a chop shop, while Rene and Tatianna catch a stash of vintage sporting goods.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An old gun 'butts' its way into the shop, before Chum comes across a Kanye West jacket. Next, Corey saves a trip to the post office when someone brings in their vintage stamp book. Later, a real-life recreation of a sword from the video game World of Warcraft arrives for inspection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey gets a magical lesson when a life-sized house elf from Harry Potter comes into the Las Vegas pawnbrokers shop. Will the seller come under his spell?.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les sells a valuable Breitling watch for $42,000 to a trusted watch collector that he dealt with many times before. His customer does not have the funds, so Les gives him the merchandise in exchange for an IOU. Seth has grave misgivings about the deal, but Les still has trust in the customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a deal to get the others off his back, but when some interesting animals come through the door, it might be too much for him to resist.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With over 40,000 wristbands to sell, stored in 126 boxes, Les decides to sell them one by one, starting at $2 apiece. Seth and Ashley remain sceptical of the idea.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley make a series of bets to see if they or Les can purchase any item that comes into the store that they would otherwise dismiss as 'junk'.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A team of ancient alien theorists explores the nothon that ghosts and angels could actually be visitors from other-worldly realms.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether Hawaii's islands may once have been inhabited by extraterrestrials and examine whether its volcanoes could provide a portal between space and time.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Even after centuries of study, the human mind remains as inscrutable as ever. Here, the host considers the abilities of the brain, and whether it may be even more powerful than hitherto realised. He also contemplates the notion that remote viewing - the practice of seeking impressions about a distant object using extrasensory perception - will one day become reality.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Emily brings her mother along, Darrell wastes no time finding an advantage, Ivy and Ivy Jr clean up with their locker, while Kenny gets some advice from a music legend. Shana and Edwina settle for thrifting what's in front of them.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Gales batter Desert Hot Springs, and the buyers do their best to keep standing. Rene and Gunther dust off an old locker, Brandi and Jarrod's unit takes a turn and ends up lapping the competition, while Kenny steps up his game big time.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public at Cheltenham Racecourse in Gloucestershire sort the treasures from their trash. A Jaeger-LeCoultre watch catches the eye of the host, and a sparkling diamond ring also makes an impression.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: With winter fast approaching and time running out, Marty Lagina makes an incredible discovery on Oak Island.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Archaeologists discover an unusual man-made rock formation in the remote Altai Mountains of Russia, and conducting a further excavation, unearth an ancient log cabin and the mummified remains of two bodies buried deep in the frozen permafrost.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: American treasure hunter John Casey returns to the Philippines with a new team and new technology to search for General Yamashita's buried gold.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: Few know that one of the US's most mysterious National Parks is in Puerto Rico - a place some believe is home to a creature known as the Chucabara.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: Many believe Gettysburg National Military Park is haunted by its violent past. This documentary explores some incredible claims about the park's history.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: The spotlight is on the judges as one comes to blows with an attorney, and another is leapt at by a defendant. A murder suspect makes a plea to the victim's family.

programme.title: Court Cam

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: An exploration of whether a cache of fantastic riches really could have been buried centuries ago on a tiny island in the North Atlantic. programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Not All That Glitters Is Gourd
programme.desc: Back in the Californian city of Orange, the Vegas Ladies arrive in vintage style - though not everyone agrees. Casey finds the chutzpah to pick up a good unit. Darrell tries to peddle his wares to Emily, but settles for a decent locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy thinks he's a comedian in Stanton California, but the gizmo in his locker is no joke. Brandi and Jarrod make sure that what they find in their unit doesn't stay there. Kenny's vintage entertainment lands him an excuse to meet a cult TV host.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and a team of antiques dealers visit Derby to offer locals the chance to put their items up for auction or accept a cash sum. James Bond memorabilia is brought to Michael Hogben's table and ancient Egyptian artefacts are a little disappointing for one seller.

programme.desc: Martha and Elli stand their ground in a dangerous encounter with a bull moose, Mike sets off for uncharted territory and Tom resurrects a primitive recurve bow. Meanwhile, Jake is hot on the trail of a mating pair of mountain lions.

programme.desc: Mike restores a 1968 Beaumont for a charity auction, but scrambles to save the build - and the fundraiser - when his budget is pulled out from under him. On his first build, Avery steals a Rust Bros client with a German-made Unimog, putting his friendship with Mike in jeopardy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate an Italian mountain that has stood witness to inexplicable phenomena for centuries, wondering whether it could somehow be attracting alien visitors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Modern prophets and the concept of predicting the future, in terms of catastrophic premonitions or dreams of future crimes. Assuming such an art is really possible, Shatner questions how such 'talent' could be used to avoid the deadly events waiting in the days to come. Alternatively, he contemplates that the future may simply be an unknowable mystery, unfolding all the time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: People who make a living from bidding for the contents of abandoned storage units. They have only a few minutes to examine the lockers before deciding whether to make the risky purchase, but they have previously found shrunken heads, work by Picasso and the world's most valuable comic collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny is feeling nostalgic in Koreatown, so brings along an old friend - a notion that may or may not be a good idea. Brandi and Jarrod sweeten their profit in an unexpected way. Ivy tolerates the big city in an effort to find some name brand goodies.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team help members of the public in Colne, Lancashire, determine which of their most treasured possessions are worth the most. Tim Hogarth is given a chance to display his charitable side when a set of medals turns up at his table, Simon Schneider is presented with items by artist Clarice Cliff, and a young couple gives Jo Brayshaw a run for her money.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: From UFOs to poltergeists, some of the most amazing, eye-opening, and downright scary paranormal videos from around the world are featured as a panel of experts break down the footage and analyse what exactly the eyewitnesses captured.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: The Nightcrawler and the Beast in the Tree
programme.desc: The team looks into a new sighting of Sasquatch in the trees of California. Plus, a man claims to have captured footage of the infamous Fresno Nightcrawlers in his back yard and mysterious streaks are witnessed in the night sky in Australia.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Paralympic athlete Jonnie Peacock traces the story of his maternal grandfather, an amateur footballer scouted by a professional team but who bowed to parental pressure to take a proper job as a painter and decorator. Jonnie uncovers the legacy of poverty and disease that led the family to value job security over sport. On his father's side, Jonnie is captivated by the life of his great-great-great-great-grandmother, a strong woman prepared to stand up in court and testify against the men who had wronged her.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Roger returns and hopes Dr Lee can help with his gigantic nose growths. Christine has lost her essence due to a large growth on her shoulder.

programme.title: Awake Surgery
programme.sub-title: Rubi Gets a Lot Less Hip
programme.desc: Dr Gruber helps mum-of-eight Rubi with her shocking hip condition. Ashley wants her 'bat wings' clipped and Jim seeks a solution for his giant neck.

programme.title: 1000-lb Best Friends
programme.desc: It's Meghan and Jon's wedding day, but someone gets cold feet. Elsewhere, Tina and Ashely are getting bariatric surgery.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.
